intro: Ampelodesmos australis, commonly known as the Australian wattlevine, is a climbing shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, typical of the legume family. It is often found in coastal and sandy areas, adapting well to saline and arid conditions. Its ecological significance includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
